repnme.cdata!: Morocco - Policy Reform Support Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            unsatisfactory, sustainability is unlikely, and both
            performances by the Bank, and Borrower, are rated
            unsatisfactory. Lessons convey that while the Bank was
            responsive to the Government's request for support, it
            may have underestimated the need to build stronger consensus
            in favor of the project, where an improved loan design would
            have better ensured implementation. Thus, a more explicit,
            and carefully planned programmatic approach could have been
            one option, provided an interim CAS, or an update, had been
            prepared as an instrument for seeking Board discussion and
            approval; another option (not exclusive from the preceding)
            could have been to find mechanisms to build broad consensus
            over the project's framework, such as open forums to
            discuss the operational scope, but, this could have weighed
            against extra time, likely delaying the required timeframe;
            moreover, a follow-up technical assistance operation, could
            have added consistency, and efficiency, by enhancing
            institutional capacity, which should have helped the new
            government in the preparation of broad economic and social
            reform agenda; additionally, another option could have been
            to make this operation a much more focused instrument, by
            concentrating the policy, and reform agenda, on the issue of
            medium-term fiscal adjustment, and institutional/structural
            reform measures, needed to support a broader operation.

repnme.cdata!: Morocco - Policy Reform Support Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Policy Reform
            Support Loan (PRSL) Project is to advance the alternance
            Government's broad-based economic and social reform
            program, which aims to accelerate Gross Domestic Product and
            employment growth, and to increase access to basic services
            and reduce poverty. The Government will pursue sound
            macroeconomic management, initiate public sector reform,
            encourage private sector development, and address the
            country's social development agenda. The benefits of
            the reform will enhance Morocco's competitiveness and
            achieve strong, sustainable growth, while advancing the
            country's important social development agenda.
            Moreover, the preparation of the loan has served to promote
            a dialogue and develop a partnership with the alternance
            Government, and act as a catalyst in setting out a
            medium-term framework for reform in Morocco. The project
            risks include: potential disruption of the authorities'
            medium-term growth forecasts, potential political opposition
            to reforms; technical implementation difficulties; and
            potential social problems. These risks will be mitigated by
            the government's effort to pursue budgetary adjustment
            and improve business environment as well as climate for
            private investment; a close policy dialogue with the
            Government and stakeholders; and a technical dialogue with
            all government agencies concerned.
